title: Specialist Physiotherapy
description: Consultant-linked physiotherapy that protects your injections, rebuilds strength, and keeps relapses away.
longDescription: Londoners travel to Marylebone for our physiotherapy because it feels like coaching, not a rushed checklist. Every session is synced with your regenerative timeline—PRP, Arthrosamid®, BMAC, or surgery-free care. We blend hands-on therapy, strength work, nervous-system retraining, and lifestyle coaching so the freedom you feel after treatment actually lasts.

hero.headline: Movement Coaching for Real Life
hero.subheadline: A Marylebone physio team that works beside Dr Abbas, so your rehab, injections, and daily habits tell the same story.

overview.title: Integrated Rehab, Designed Around You
overview.content: Your programme begins with a 60-minute assessment—strength testing, gait video, mobility mapping, sleep and stress review. Then we design a plan that mirrors your biology: deloading while tissue remodels, strength when collagen matures, and accountability so you finish the plan feeling strong.

faq.question: How often do I attend?
faq.answer: Weekly for the first 4–6 sessions, then bi-weekly once strength and confidence return.

faq.question: Do I need injections first?
faq.answer: No. We treat standalone cases, but we also build protocols that sync with PRP, BMAC, Arthrosamid®, or surgery.

faq.question: Will I get homework?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Expect video-guided exercises, breathwork drills, and lifestyle nudges between sessions so progress sticks.

schema.howPerformed: Patients receive a 60-minute assessment followed by weekly hands-on therapy and guided strength sessions. Exercises are demonstrated in-clinic and delivered via app with real-time feedback, ensuring perfect form at home.
schema.preparation: Wear comfortable training clothing and bring any imaging or consultant letters. Hydrate well and arrive five minutes early for onboarding.
schema.followup: Weekly or bi-weekly sessions with digital check-ins. Formal progress reviews every six sessions to adjust load, mobility, and lifestyle habits.
schema.outcome: Improved strength, balance, neuromuscular control, and pain-free range of motion that keeps regenerative treatment results lasting.
schema.treatmentFrequency: Weekly or bi-weekly programmes lasting 6–12 sessions
schema.adverseOutcome: Temporary muscle soreness after progressive loading.
